TopicTitle: Things are looking up for the world

Articles.Content:
In an age of Social Media crazes and 'Youtube Sensations' things are starting to look up.

Educational single-board computers and microprocessors are the future.
If only that were true tom.
gah! I have been tricked into a false sense of security!
But I got something similar after I cleared my history!
As an amateur web coder/developer, "getting started with wordpress" saddens me greatly.

I'm very familiar with filter bubble, but I don't think that applies here

I tried the same search in porn incognito mode

If only that were true tom.

Also known as Targeted marketing.

I should point out that I did my search from work, so not only was I not logged in and not submitting cookies, I was coming from an IP shared by many people who are not geeks, so even if searches were compared by IP those still wouldn't be my searches.

It obviously has more to do with the words "getting started" Non-geeks are likely using "How to"
That this seems to be immune to bubbling is pretty good news
it's more likely caused by Google being paid to give those particular results... Which is bubbling, but artificially inflated bubbling caused by manual "adjustment" of the initial data.

Also known as Targeted marketing.

Well I get tons of HobbyKing adverts after my frequent browsing so...

But it is good news that even without the Bubbles it gives the same results. If only wordpress was replaced by HTML but maybe I am going too far.
yup. Visited a travel agency website yesterday to look up ideas for a short vacation, now every other Google ad is for that same agency (which I rejected because of their pricing...).

it's more likely caused by Google being paid to give those particular results... Which is bubbling, but artificially inflated bubbling caused by manual "adjustment" of the initial data.

Google don't allow paid for results to appear in the main search field. Doing so would dilute the credibility of their search, which is their main product. Paid results show up on the right and are labelled as such.

If only wordpress was replaced by HTML but maybe I am going too far.

Er, what do you mean? Wordpress is HTML/PHP/MySQL.

Not everyone needs to be creating their site from scratch themselves, even if they can. I can write HTML/CSS, but I use Wordpress for my personal blog. Why reinvent the wheel? Sod creating a whole content management system from scratch every time you build a little site.

Seret makes a good point. Actually, lets take the Arduino and Raspberry-pi in to the picture too.

Would the world be better off if more people would want to know about those? I don't think so.

What I think would improve the world is if more people learn how to reason.

Google don't allow paid for results to appear in the main search field. Doing so would dilute the credibility of their search, which is their main product. Paid results show up on the right and are labelled as such.

They show up in a peach coloured box at the Top of all my search results and have done for ages...

They used to show up in the search results with the words 'paid ad' after where it listed the HTTP address, but that was years ago, and they still were a different colour.

On mine I get a local university first, Grant second and then Arduion and Raspberry pi, and I've certainly looked more at Arduion and Raspbery pi then universities and grants.

Edited August 21, 2013 by sjwt

Er, what do you mean? Wordpress is HTML/PHP/MySQL.

Not everyone needs to be creating their site from scratch themselves, even if they can. I can write HTML/CSS, but I use Wordpress for my personal blog. Why reinvent the wheel? Sod creating a whole content management system from scratch every time you build a little site.

Fair enough, I'm no webdev so my opinion isn't really credible. Sorry for jumping to conclusions. On a completely different note, I think the Raspberry Pi initiative is a fantastic thing. So is the Arduino.
